alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 6:31PM CST until February 02 at 6:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Pascagoula River At Graham Ferry affecting Jackson County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pascagoula River at Graham Ferry. * WHEN...Until Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, River property at Cumbest Bluff will be cut off by high water and some river roads will be impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:45 PM CST Tuesday the stage was 16.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.1 feet tomorrow morning then begin falling. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued Wednesday afternoon at 1245 PM CST.
